t: Jeremiah 13
Symbol of the Linen Sash
Thus*p the Lord*s said to me: “Go and get yourself a linen sash, and put it around your waist, but do not put it in water.”
So I got a sash according to the word of the Lord,*s and put it*i around my waist.
And*p the word of the Lord*s came to me the second time, saying,
“Take the sash that you acquired, which is*i around your waist, and arise, go to the Euphrates, and hide it there in a hole in the rock.”
So I went and hid it by the Euphrates, as the Lord*s commanded me.
Now*p it came to pass after many days that the Lord*s said to me, “Arise, go to the Euphrates, and take from there the sash which I commanded you to hide there.”
Then I went to the Euphrates and dug, and I took the sash from the place where I had hidden it; and there was the sash, ruined. It was profitable for nothing.
Then*p the word of the Lord*s came to me, saying,
“Thus says the Lord:*s ‘In this manner I will ruin the pride of Judah and the great pride of Jerusalem.

This evil people, who refuse to hear My words, who follow the dictates of their hearts, and walk after other gods to serve them and worship them, shall be just like this sash which is profitable for nothing.

For as the sash clings to the waist of a man, so I have caused the whole house of Israel and the whole house of Judah to cling to Me,’ says the Lord,*s ‘that they may become My people, for renown, for praise, and for glory; but they would not hear.’
Symbol of the Wine Bottles

“Therefore*p you shall speak to them this word: ‘Thus says the Lord*s God of Israel: “Every bottle shall be filled with wine.”’ And*p they will say to you, ‘Do we not certainly know that every bottle will be filled with wine?’

“Then*p you shall say to them, ‘Thus says the Lord:*s “Behold, I will fill all the inhabitants of this land—even the kings who sit on David’s throne, the priests, the prophets, and all the inhabitants of Jerusalem— with drunkenness!
And I will dash them one against another, even the fathers and the sons together,” says the Lord.*s “I will not pity nor spare nor have mercy, but will destroy them.”’”
Pride Precedes Captivity
Hear*pn and give ear: Do*ld not be proud, For*ld the Lord*s has spoken.

Give*ld glory to the Lord*s your God Before*ld He causes darkness, And*ld before your feet stumble On*ld the dark mountains, And*ld while you are looking for light, He*ld turns it into the shadow of death And*ild makes it*i dense darkness.
But*ld if you will not hear it, My*ld soul will weep in secret for your*i pride; My*ld eyes will weep bitterly And*ld run down with tears, Because*ld the Lord’s*s flock has been taken captive.
Say*ln to the king and to the queen mother, “Humble*ld yourselves; Sit*ld down, For*ld your rule shall collapse, the crown of your glory.”
The*ld cities of the South shall be shut up, And*ld no one shall open them;*i Judah*ld shall be carried away captive, all of it; It*ld shall be wholly carried away captive.
Lift*ln up your eyes and see Those*ld who come from the north. Where*ld is*i the flock that*i was given to you, Your*ld beautiful sheep?
What*ld will you say when He punishes you? For*ld you have taught them To*ild be*i chieftains, to be head over you. Will*ld not pangs seize you, Like*ld a woman in labor?
And*ld if you say in your heart, “Why*ld have these things come upon me?” For*ld the greatness of your iniquity Your*ld skirts have been uncovered, Your*ld heels made bare.
Can*ld the Ethiopian change his skin or the leopard its spots? Then*ild may you also do good who are accustomed to do evil.
“Therefore*ln I will scatter them like stubble That*ld passes away by the wind of the wilderness.
This*ld is your lot, The*ld portion of your measures from Me,” says the Lord,*s “Because*ld you have forgotten Me And*ld trusted in falsehood.
Therefore*ld I will uncover your skirts over your face, That*ld your shame may appear.

I*ld have seen your adulteries And*ld your lustful*i neighings, The*ld lewdness of your harlotry, Your*ld abominations on the hills in the fields. Woe*ld to you, O Jerusalem! Will*ld you still not be made clean?”
